alert.note: Alert for De Kalb; DuPage; Kane; Kendall; Lee; Northern Will; Southern Cook (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 25 at 11:25AM CST until January 25 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by a combination of rain, snowmelt, and heavy river ice is possible. * WHERE...Portions of north central and northeast Illinois, including the following areas, in north central Illinois, De Kalb and Lee. In northeast Illinois, DuPage, Kane, Kendall, Northern Will and Southern Cook. * WHEN...Through Monday morning. * IMPACTS...Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Poor drainage areas may become inundated. Storm drains and ditches may be clogged with snow and ice, causing localized flooding. Localized water level fluctuations may occur due to shifting river ice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Snowpack, which contains up to 2.0 inches of water equivalent, will continue to melt across the area. In addition, rainfall tonight may add runoff due to frozen soils. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Watch means flooding is possible, but not yet certain, based upon the latest forecasts. Persons with interests along area rivers, creeks, and other waterways should monitor the latest forecasts and be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: De Kalb; DuPage; Kane; Kendall; Lee; Northern Will; Southern Cook
